intro: Galeopsis dubia var. cryptantha, commonly known as the cryptantha horseweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its small, pale blue or violet flowers are arranged in whorled clusters along the stem. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in temperate climates.
